From Interstate I-71 northbound, take Ohio Exit 24 (Western Row Road/Kings Island).  At the end of the exit ramp, turn left (West) on Western Row Road/Tylersville Road.  Stay right on the three lane road to stay on Tylersville Road.  At the intersection of Tylersville Road with Mason-Montgomer Road, turn right (north).  One mile north, Mason-Montgomery Road intersects with Main Street (State Route 42).  You are now in downtown Mason, Ohio.

From Interstate I-71 southbound, take the Kings Mills Road exit.  Kings Mills Road west.  At a T-intersection, Route 741 turns north, Kings Mills turns south.  Kings Mills Road curves through a residential neighborhood before turning back to the west.  Kings Mills Ts into Main Street (State Route 42).  Turn left (west) on Main Street about 3 blocks to the intersection of Main Street with Mason-Montgomery Road.  You are in downtown Mason, Ohio.

From Interstate I-75, take the Tylersville Road exit.  Drive east to the intersection of Mason-Montgomery Road with Tylersville Road.  Turn left (north) onto Mason-Montgomery Road.  One mile north, Mason-Montgomery Road intersects with Main Street (State Route 42).  You are now in downtown Mason, Ohio.

, Southwest Ohio Regional Transit Authority, provides bus service from downtown Cincinnati to a parking lot at Western Row Road and Columbia Road and along Bus Route 71/72 (I-71/Columbia Road/Montgomery Road/Fields Ertel Road).
Mason served by three major airports:

value: http://www.port-columbus.com/home.asp Port Columbus International Airport, Columbus (CMH)
http://www.daytonairport.com/ James M Cox Dayton International Airport, Dayton (DAY)

Each airport can be accessed from Mason with at least some portion of interstate driving.

Estimated driving time from Mason to the airports are:

value: '''Mason to CVG: 45 minutes; I-71 South to I-75 South to I-275 West to Airport Exit.
'''Mason to CMH: 90 minutes; I-71 North to I-670 East to Airport Exit, Exit #9.
'''Mason to DAY: 60 minutes; Tylersville Road to I-75 North, through downtown Dayton, to I-70 West to Airport Exit.
content=Home to many antiques, photographs, documents, and artifacts detailing Mason's history.

content=Kings Island is one of the world's greatest amusement parks. The park is divided into three different areas - the main park with adult attractions, a children's park, and a water park. Admission to the park grants access to every one of the areas. Kings Island is also the home to record holding coasters like the Beast, the world's longest wooden roller coaster. While you are at the park, don’t miss the chance to ride Kings Island’s 14th and newest rollercoaster, Firehawk, which simulates actual human flight by propelling riders 150 feet in the air at speeds of over 50 mph.
directions=The park is in Mason, and is near Kings Island.

content= At The Beach Waterpark, parents and kids get soaked at more than 40 water rides and attractions. Go airborne on the five-story drop of The Cliff, ride the foaming river of Volcanic Panic, and propel your body at 65-miles per hour on The Banzai. With volleyball and basketball courts, teen and reggae dance nights, and the award-winning Dive-In Movies, a visit will truly be a day at The Beach!

content=With over 400 lodge-themed suites you can get soaked at one of America's largest indoor water parks, measuring 78,000 sq. ft., with eleven waterslides, six pools, an interactive treehouse waterfort, and 410,000 gallons of heated water - all year round.
name=The Golf Center at Kings Island
content=18 Holes of Golf designed by Jack Nicklaus. Experience the Grizzly-the 18 hole championship course played by the best of the PGA, the LPGA, and the Senior PGA TOUR for the last 30 years.
name=Western & Southern Financial Group Masters & Women's Open

content=The best and brightest in tennis visit Mason every year for this premier tour stop. The Women's event is held in July and features players the likes of Serena Williams. The Men's event is held in August and features players the likes of Roger Federer and Andy Roddick.
name=AVP Cincinnati Open: Pro Beach Volleyball Championship Series
content=The best men's and women's pro beach volleyball players battle it out in the AVP's season-ending event in late August. Mason will host the tournament through 2011.

content="Where the legend lives" is the motto of this premier Harley dealer. You can buy new or used bikes, as well as purchase all the parts, accessories, and apparel to keep you and your hog in tip-top shape.
directions=From Tylersville Road, Take Reading Road (State Route 42) North; Building is on the Right
directions=2nd Building East of the intersection of Mason-Montgomery Road with Main Street (State Route 42)
hours=Mon-Wed 10 - 6; Thur 10 - 8; Fri 10 - 6; Sat 10 - 5; Closed Sun

content= Shop for beads, findings, clasps, toggles, earwires, stone pendants, sterling silver jewelry chain, gold-filled jewelry chain, antique copper jewelry chain, gunmetal jewelry chain, brass jewelry chain and other jewelry making supplies.

content=4920 Socialville-Foster Road. Arloi Dee’s authentic Thai cuisine is flavored with a variety of fresh herbs and distinct spices, which creates a wide range of exotic tastes. The food ranges from mild and subtly flavored dishes to hot and fiery. Arloi Dee has been featured in publications like the Cincinnati Enquirer and Ohio Magazine.

content=The Polo Grille, located in the Deerfield Towne Center on Mason-Montgomery Road, was created to pay tribute to the Cincinnati Polo Club. The Polo Grille features traditional American cuisine with influences from countries where polo is most popular. The Polo Grille also features a wide selection of fine wines and martinis, called Polotinis.

content=Large selection of single malt Scotch and Irish whiskies, plus a wide selection of imported beers on tap. Warm up next to the stone fireplace. Enjoy outstanding Irish cuisine in the comfort of an intimate booth.
address=316 West Main Street. Mason, OH 45040

The only possible warning is to watch out for drunk drivers on the weekends.  Also, be wary of Mason Pub for gang activity.
